CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13+6 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy) (Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Rožňava .

CARDINAL . On DATE an individual ( “ the claimant ” ) filed a petition with a judicial enforcement officer ( “ JEO ” ) for the enforcement of the equivalent of CARDINAL euros ( ORG ) worth of an adjudicated claim against the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG requested authorisation to carry out the enforcement under file no . Ex CARDINAL/CARDINAL . The authorisation was granted by ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) on DATE under the file no . CARDINALEr CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued a notice of enforcement ( upovedomenie o začatí exekúcie ) , by which he notified the applicant that enforcement proceedings had commenced against him . The notice specified that amounts to be enforced comprised the above - mentioned principal amount , the equivalents of some EUR CARDINAL in court fees , LAW in the ORG ’s remuneration and LAW in the ORG ’s expenses .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant challenged the notice of enforcement by way of a protest ( námietky ) to ORG arguing that the principal amount had already been paid and disputing the claim for compensation in respect of the ORG ’s remuneration and expenses .
CARDINAL . On DATE the claimant filed his observations in reply to the applicant ’s protest and , on CARDINAL DATE , the ORG transmitted these observations to ORG for determination of the protest .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the protest in part which concerned the principal amount and dismissed its remainder . That decision became final and binding on DATE , following which DATE on DATE ORG discontinued the enforcement proceedings in so far as the principal amount was concerned . The latter decision became final and binding on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a petition that the remainder of the enforcement be discontinued too , which ORG dismissed on DATE by a decision that became final and binding on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon ultimate termination of the outstanding part of the enforcement proceedings , the ORG returned the authorisation deed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint under LAW to ORG . Relying on LAW , he contended that the length of the enforcement proceedings against him had been excessive .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the complaint inadmissible on the ground that , prior to his constitutional complaint , the applicant had failed to exhaust ordinary remedies , in particular the complaint to the President of ORG .
ORG decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
